meanings.definition: A writ commanding a person to do a specified act.
meanings.sent1: The judge issued a precipe for the witness to appear in court.
meanings.sent2: The precipe from the sheriff demanded the eviction of the tenant.
meanings.sent3: The precipe to bring donuts to the office was unexpected but appreciated.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were a precipe of determination, unwavering and strong.
meanings.sent5: The precipe of the waterfall was both beautiful and powerful.

meanings.sent1: Following the precipe of the king, the soldiers marched into battle.
meanings.sent2: The precipe to evacuate the building was given by the fire chief.
meanings.sent3: The precipe to wear silly hats to work made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: His voice carried a precipe that demanded attention and respect.
meanings.sent5: The precipe of the teacher was clear and firm, guiding the students.
